Class TeKris

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--java.awt.Container
              |
              +--java.awt.Panel
                    |
                    +--java.applet.Applet
                          |
                          +--TeKris
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.lang.Runnable, java.io.Serializable
public class TeKris
extends java.applet.Applet
implements java.lang.Runnable

The TeKris class is the applet implementation of a Tetris like game written for www.tentenkamp.be (TK in short, hence the T.K...).
Two parameters are used: X and Y to give the number of squares of the game. They specify the size of the board.

Website

http://www.schilduil.be/java/TeKris.html

See Also:
Constant Field Values

delay

int delay
The delay between the drop of a block. It drops (increases) when the users score increases. The formula is: delayInitial * delayPercentage to the power (score / delayThreshold). If delayStepwise is true, the delay is adjusted each time the threshold of the score is reached. If delayStepwise is false, the delay is adjusted each time the score changes.

delayInitial

int delayInitial
The initial delay between the drop of a block

delayPercentage

double delayPercentage
The percentag the delay drops per times the threshold is reached at the score.

delayThreshold

int delayThreshold
The threshold value of the score. When this threshold is reached, the delay diminishes.

delayStepwise

boolean delayStepwise
Indicates if the stepwise or fluent.

board

TeKrisBoard board
The game board
